body_html:
I ran that code in ubuntu 14.04, python 3.5.2.
When I ran that code, main process consumed 327Mb of memory and sub processes consumed 311Mb so I thought that tensor is not properly shared.
However, when I changed the size of the tensor to (1000,1000,200), main process consumed 1837Mb and sub processes consumed same 311Mb.
I don't know why sub processes consumes so much memory but I think my problem is solved:) Thank you!

When I ran that code, main process consumed 327Mb of memory and sub processes consumed 311Mb so I thought that tensor is not properly shared.

body:
I ran that code in ubuntu 14.04, python 3.5.2.
When I ran that code, main process consumed 327Mb of memory and sub processes consumed 311Mb so I thought that tensor is not properly shared.
However, when I changed the size of the tensor to (1000,1000,200), main process consumed 1837Mb and sub processes consumed same 311Mb.
I don't know why sub processes consumes so much memory but I think my problem is solved:) Thank you!
